panels.content:
LizardFS is a distributed, scalable, fault-tolerant and highly available file system. It allows users to combine disk space located on many servers into a single name space which is visible on Unix-like and Windows systems in the same way as other file systems. LizardFS makes files secure by keeping all the data in many replicas spread over available servers.

LizardFS keeps metadata (like file names, modification timestamps, directory trees) and the actual data separately. Metadata is kept on metadata servers, while data is kept on machines called chunkservers

targets.query: SELECT 100 - last("Available_space")  / last(Total_space) * 100 FROM "lizard_info" WHERE "lizardmaster" =~ /^$Master$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT 100 - last("Available_space")  / last(Total_space) * 100 FROM "lizard_info" WHERE "lizardmaster" =~ /^$Master$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT last("version") AS "version", "ip", "port", "personality", "status", "metadata_version" FROM "lizard_metadataservers" WHERE "lizardmaster" =~ /^$Master$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "hostname"

panels.content:
# MetaDataServers 
At least two metadata servers, which work in master-slave mode for failure recovery. Their role is also to manage the whole installation, so the active metadata server is often called the master server. The role of other metadata servers is just to keep in sync with the active master servers, so they are often called shadow master servers. Any shadow master server is ready to take the role of the active master server at any time

targets.query: SELECT last("Available_space") AS "Available", last("Total_space") AS "Total" FROM "lizard_info" WHERE "lizardmaster" =~ /^$Master$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "lizardmaster" fill(null)

panels.content:
# ChunkServers
A set of chunkservers which store the data. Each file is divided into blocks called chunks (each up to 64 MiB) which are stored on the chunkservers.

list.name: Master
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM lizard_info WITH KEY=lizardmaster

list.name: ChunkServer
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "lizard_chunkservers" WITH KEY = "server" where "lizardmaster" =~ /^$Master$/

list.name: Goal
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "lizard_chunks-health" WITH KEY = "goal" where "lizardmaster" =~ /^$Master$/
